financial_benefits.description: Antigua and Barbuda does not impose local income tax on foreign-sourced income for digital nomads.
The Eastern Caribbean Dollar (XCD) is the local currency, providing a stable financial environment.

lifestyle_benefits.description: Enjoy a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round.
Antigua and Barbuda offers a high quality of life with beautiful beaches and friendly locals.

additional_benefits.description: English is the official language, making communication easy for most expatriates.
The island has a rich culture with numerous festivals, including one of the Caribbean's most popular carnivals.

key_consideration: The Antigua Nomad Digital Residence program allows remote workers to live and work in Antigua and Barbuda for up to two years with no local tax on foreign income.
action_comment: Consider Antigua and Barbuda for its tropical climate, vibrant culture, and favorable tax conditions for digital nomads.
tagline: Work and live in paradise in Antigua and Barbuda.
tax_residency_trigger_details: You are considered a tax resident if you stay for longer than 183 days in a calendar year.

visas.key_consideration: The visa can be renewed after the initial two-year period.

income_requirement.misc_details: Applicants must have an annual income of at least $50,000.

application_fee.details: Fee covers the main applicant, spouse, and up to two dependents. Additional dependents cost $250 each.

visas.renewability_details: The visa can be renewed after the initial two-year period.
visas.permanent_residency_details: Digital nomad visa does not lead to permanent residency.

special_regimes.name: Digital Nomad Visa
special_regimes.benefit: No income tax on foreign-sourced income.
eligibility: Proof of employment, self-employment, or freelance work that can be done remotely.
Valid police clearance from the past 6 months.
Health insurance covering the duration of stay.

required_documents: Full-color passport size photo for you and any dependent traveling with you. JPEG format.
Full-color copy of your partner’s, and/or dependents’ passport bio-page. The passports must be valid for at least 2 more years. JPEG format.
If traveling with a partner, copy of marriage certificate or a notarized letter of relationship if not married. PDF Format.
Certificate of medical insurance for all applicants for the period of your stay in the country. PDF or JPEG format.
Police clearance for applicants over 16 years. PDF format.
Proof of employment or self-employment in the form of a job letter, work permit, salary payments, or any other documentation that supports your activity. PDF format.
Proof of available funds of the main applicant. This can be any documentation that proves that you have:
Proof of payment of the non-refundable application fee. JPEG or PDF format.

visas.key_consideration: Long term visa options for stays exceeding one year.
